intro: Calophysa poeppigii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are typically palmately lobed, and it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Calophysa poeppigii is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
